alert.note: Alert for East Turnagain Arm (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 09 at 7:57PM AKST until December 11 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON SUNDAY TO 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Visibility one quarter mile or less at times. Total snow accumulations of 15 to 30 inches, with local amounts up to 36 inches possible. East winds gusting as high as 60 mph, strongest through Portage Valley. * WHERE...East Turnagain Arm. * WHEN...From noon Sunday to 6 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult. Heavy snow and blowing snow will lead to white-out conditions at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will develop by midday Sunday, then intensify through the afternoon and evening hours. Winds will strengthen through this same time frame. The heaviest snow will be Sunday evening through early Monday morning. Snow could briefly mix with or change to rain at sea level early Monday morning, which will affect the storm total snow accumulation.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
